Users functionality¶

Users’ models¶

The module models.py is used to create the models of the application.

It contains the following class: - Profile: The class Profile is used to create the model of the profile. After creating the models, we need to migrate them to the database.

To do this, we need to run the following commands: - python manage.py makemigrations - python manage.py migrate

class users.models.Profile(*args, **kwargs)¶

The class Profile is used to create the model of the profile.

Users’ views¶

The module view is contents the function that will be called when the user types the url. The view function will return a response to the user. The response can be a html page. The view function can also call other functions to process the request.

Users’ forms¶

The module forms is used to create forms for the models. The forms are used in the views.py file.

class users.forms.RegisterForm(*args, **kwargs)¶

The class RegisterForm is used to create a form for the User model.

class users.forms.LoginForm(request=None, *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: AuthenticationForm

The class LoginForm is used to create a form for the User model.

class users.forms.ProfileForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)¶

Bases: ModelForm

The class ProfileForm is used to create a form for the Profile model.

Users’ urls¶

The module urls is used to map the url to the view function. The url is the path that the user will type in the browser.

param:

you have to pass the path and the view function

return:

path to the template

Users’ tests¶

This module is used to test the users app. But first, you need to create a test database and the tests. To create a test database, use the command: python manage.py migrate –database=test

To run the tests, use the command: python manage.py test noteapp

Users’ signals¶

The module signals is used to create signals for the models. The signals are used in the models.py file.

users.signals.create_profile(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)¶
The create_profile function is a receiver that gets called via the post_save signal whenever a User object is created.

It checks if the created user was actually saved to the database (created == True), and then creates a corresponding Profile instance.

Parameters:

  • sender – Specify the model that is being used

  • instance – Pass the user instance to the profile model

  • created – Check if the user is created or not

  • kwargs – Pass keyworded, variable-length argument list

Returns:

A profile object

users.signals.save_profile(sender, instance, **kwargs)¶

The save_profile function is a receiver that handles post_save signals from User instances. Whenever a User is created and saved, the function creates an associated Profile instance using the create_profile() method we defined earlier. Whenever a User instance is updated and saved, it updates its associated Profile.

Parameters:

  • sender – Specify the model that is sending the signal

  • instance – Pass the user instance to the save_profile function

  • kwargs – Pass a variable number of keyword arguments to a function

Returns:

Nothing
